alert.note: Alert for Juana Diaz; Santa Isabel (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued November 05 at 7:52PM AST until November 05 at 10:00PM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Juan has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Juana Diaz County in Puerto Rico... Santa Isabel County in Puerto Rico... * Until 1000 PM AST. * At 752 PM AST, Emergency management reported flooding and mudslides across many areas of Santa Isabel and Juana Diaz. In addition, the Jacaguas River in Juana Diaz is approaching moderate flood stage. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. Mudslides are possible in areas of steep terrain. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
